About the New York Times Bestseller List

What is the list for?

The NYT Bestseller list, which can be viewed here, is an "authoritatively ranked list of books sold in the United States, sorted by format and genre." The list we're querying is released on a weekly basis.

What books are included in the ranking?

There are all kinds of genre and format specific lists published by the NYT, but we are specifically searching from the main list, of "Combined Print and E-Book Fiction". It's possible to extend this tool to include other lists as options, but that was not within the scope of our project.

How are books rankings determined?

According to the Times, "Rankings reflect unit sales reported on a confidential basis by vendors offering a wide range of general interest titles published in the United States. Every week, thousands of diverse selling locations report their actual sales on hundreds of thousands of individual titles. The panel of reporting retailers is comprehensive and reflects sales in tens of thousands of stores of all sizes and demographics across the United States."

Why is this book not released yet?

Sometimes the list includes pre-ordered books, which may not be available yet at your library.
